definition: exam room
to test/to try/experiment/examination/test
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]

sentences.english: No examination centres will be set up in any overseas cities for the coming CRE.
sentences.chinese: 当局不会为是次考试在海外城市设立试场。

sentences.english: Note : (1) Driving tests for articulated vehicle are available at Shatin Centre only.
sentences.chinese: 挂接式车辆的驾驶考试只在沙田试场举行。

sentences.english: A test-taker should present either a valid passport with photo attached or an ARC card to the test centers.
sentences.chinese: 请携带附有照片的护照或居留证正本到试场参加考试。

sentences.english: A test-taker should present either a valid passport or an ARC card to the test center.
sentences.chinese: 请携带护照或居留证正本到试场参加考试。

sentences.english: No early leaves are permitted in examinations where multiple-choice questions are set.
sentences.chinese: 学生不得于任何选择题形式的考试中提早离开试场。

definition: to go and sit an examination
to take an exam
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
the exam period/the exam date
autumn exam (triennial provincial exam during Ming and Qing)
exam paper
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
an examiner/an official conducting an exam
military drill ground
metropolitan examination (imperial civil service examination)
successful military candidate in the imperial provincial examination
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
prefectural exam, the 2nd of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
to copy out
to take an exam
